model

Class AbstractTileContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractTileContainer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BucketTileContainer, NullTileContainer, NumberTileContainer

    public abstract class AbstractTileContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract representation of a TileContainer in the Board. Some tileContainers are null, some are buckets, but all have an x and a y, can be adjacent to other tiles, and have knowledge of whether you can add things to them
    Author:
    jesse

      Constructs an AbstractTileContainer at column x and row y

      Set the used variable when adding a tile to a move, this should be set with true when finishing a move, this should be set to false

    • Method Detail

      • isAdjacentTo

        public boolean isAdjacentTo(AbstractTileContainer other)
        Checks if the other tile is adjacent to this tile. Tiles are adjacent if they next to each other horizontally or vertically
        Parameters:
        other - the other tile
        Returns:
        true if the tiles are adjacent, false otherwise

      • marked

        public boolean marked()
        A tile being marked means it counts towards the completion goal on elimination levels
        Returns:
        true if the tile is marked, false otherwise

      • mark

        public void mark()
        sets marked to true

      • used

        public boolean used()
        A tile being used means it is involved in a move, and should be drawn differently in the BoardView
        Returns:
        true if the tile is being used, false otherwise

      • setUsed

        public void setUsed(boolean used)
        Set the used variable when adding a tile to a move, this should be set with true when finishing a move, this should be set to false
        Parameters:
        used - whether or not the tile is being used in a move

      • clearTile

        public void clearTile()
        For buckets, null tiles, clearing means nothing, and nothing happens NumberTileContainers override this
